Title: In Old Chicago
Production_Co: Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck Productions
Cast: Tyrone Power, Alice Faye, Don Ameche, Alice Brady, Andy Devine, Brian Donlevy, Phyllis Brooks, Tom Brown, Sidney Blackmer, Berton Churchill, June Storey, Paul Hurst, Tyler Brooke, J. Anthony Hughes, Gene Reynolds
Plot: The O'Leary brothers -- honest Jack and roguish Dion -- become powerful figures, and eventually rivals, in Chicago on the eve of its Great Fire. Story of the great fire of 1871. Fictional story of two sons of Mrs. O'Leary (the owner of the cow which started the fire), one a rogue (Power) the other a lawyer (Ameche). One of the most expensive films of its time ($1.8 million). Written by Ed Stephan <stephan@cc.wwu.edu>
Keywords: fire, lawyer, cow, brother, disaster film
Actors: Tyrone Power, Alice Faye, Don Ameche
Writer: Lamar Trotti (screen play), Sonya Levien (screen play) | 1 more credit »
Description: Directed by Henry King.  With Tyrone Power, Alice Faye, Don Ameche, Alice Brady. The O'Leary brothers -- honest Jack and roguish Dion -- become powerful figures, and eventually rivals, in Chicago on the eve of its Great Fire.
